channel.title: What is the best political ideology?
channel.description:
What is the best political ideology?
Communism won't work because of human nature. I really don't understand how people can think it can work when it has failed numerous times. Sure USSR's economy boomed but the quality of life diminished incredibly.

communism, too bad humans can’t handle it.

what are you talking about, china is a perfect example of communism gone right

item.title: What is the best political ideology?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I don’t know if there’s a name for it.
Basically there are some villages around on this globe where a small amount of people live together in a trade system.
Ones likes to bake, so he provides bread an other one loves to paint so he goes painting for people.
No laws except for the obvious main ethics, you shall not kill & hurt others and you shall not steal.

This is impossible on places where big amounts of people live, but in small communities this would be amazing.

Read full topic

item.title: What is the best political ideology?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:13, topic:454862”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=557728.msg4080587#msg4080587 date=1345328705]
What is the best political ideology?

Communism won’t work because of human nature. I really don’t understand how people can think it can work when it has failed numerous times. Sure USSR’s economy boomed but the quality of life diminished incredibly.
[/quote]

there is no “best political ideology”[/quote]

Oh really? I DIDN’T KNOW THAT.

[quote=“m1lkman, post:4, topic:454862”]I don’t know. Bowser wanted me to make a topic so I made one.

Isn’t it obvious what I am asking?

Edit: Changed thread title.
Edit2: This thread is retarded. I’m sure people will use their common sense to understand what is trying to be discussed.[/quote]

I guess I was wrong.

Read full topic
item.source: What is the best political ideology?

item.title: What is the best political ideology?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

There is definitely an ideology that is better than another in a given situation. In a oil rich country free-marked thinking is ridiculous, since that is basicly giving away money to corporations for free.

A true communist state is currently impossible, since in this time you need to be able to defend yourself. For that a more organized government is necessary. You also need to gain control over the economy, and we all know what happen to Cuba when Castro tried it.

Read full topic
item.source: What is the best political ideology?

item.title: What is the best political ideology?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:1, topic:454862”]What is the best political ideology?

Communism won’t work because of human nature. I really don’t understand how people can think it can work when it has failed numerous times. Sure USSR’s economy boomed but the quality of life diminished incredibly.[/quote]

there is no “best political ideology”

communism isn’t a political ideology, and in the sense that people think of it as one there has never been a communist country before

on the subject of a communist state, in the sense that I understand it I think it can totally work, strict guidelines would need to be followed and I don’t necessarily think it can be done with a whole country but a micro-nation communist state would work I think

item.source: What is the best political ideology?

item.title: What is the best political ideology?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

The “Human Nature” argument is a poor argument. You should know that life under the Tsar wasn’t that good either, and I’ve heard no-one claiming post Stalin Soviet to be communist. For while Stalin and Lenin might both be communists, the state itself wasn’t transformed into a communist state. While you could call a state with that intent communist, USSR had for the most time not this intent.

I would make the case that Cuba is the world most successful country, on the basis of two things. Their way of life is sustainable, and they have the best living standard among such countries.

North Korea have a glorious future with its finding of valuable metals in their mountains. Their control over economy secures that the resources wouldn’t be pocketed by an American company. If they manage to fight of US invaders. (If they can avoid South Korea, that would be another Vietnam). Their new Kim in charge has shown promising signs, but not signs of stupidity, so their new riches might benefit the people.

To close this off, in Easy Germany and Romania, about 50% think life was better with Soviet.
http://www.thediplomat.ro/articol.php?id=1444
http://mltoday.com/subject-areas/social-and-economic-conditions/life-was-better-under-socialism-say-eastern-germans-982.html
This high percentage should tell us something. If USSR and USA didn’t try to impress each other all the time, things could be much better.

Read full topic
item.source: What is the best political ideology?

item.title: What is the best political ideology?
item.dc:creator: @Carter2 Carter_
item.description:
@Carter2 wrote:

To be blatantly general, all government are corrupt in some way or another. But then what do you believe. Papers report about corrupt officials and yet the papers are hardly ones to provide solid facts as they are run by the same corrupt officials that are being “exposed”.

I don’t trust the government but I have no choice other than to be pushed along quietly in this society because I have no other choice if I want to survive in this world.

Freedom is so over rated.

Read full topic

item.title: What is the best political ideology?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:2, topic:454862”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=557728.msg4080587#msg4080587 date=1345328705]
What is the best type of government for the people?

Democracy, Communism, Totalitarianism? Or some other form?
[/quote]
i don’t think any of those are forms of governments…[/quote]

I don’t know. Bowser wanted me to make a topic so I made one.

Isn’t it obvious what I am asking?

Edit: Changed thread title.
Edit2: This thread is retarded. I’m sure people will use their common sense to understand what is trying to be discussed.

Communism won’t work because of human nature. I really don’t understand how people can think it can work when it has failed numerous times. Sure USSR’s economy boomed but the quality of life diminished incredibly.

Read full topic
